page.title: 07BURTON CONSTABLE HALL
page.content: { "It is likely that the Constables {came over with the Conqueror"}begins the guidebook. They bought the manor in the early 12th century and lived there from the{16th century}when the original Hall was built. Its present owner,{John Chichester-Constable, 46th {Lord Paramount of the Seignory of {Holderness}lives in part of the Hall, which was enlarged and remodelled in the late 18th century. Its great rooms are filled with the furnishings of its period and with examples of William Constable's skill in science, and the music, art and theatre of a life-style now gone. The Hall is open to visitors during the summer, and is increasingly the venue for{balls, wedding receptions, {parties}and other}functions where a gracious environment is welcome.
